meanings.definition: A rope or cord used for lowering or raising something.
meanings.sent1: The seil was strong and sturdy, perfect for lifting heavy objects.
meanings.sent2: I need to buy a new seil for my fishing boat.
meanings.sent3: The seil decided to take a break and relax on the dock.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a seil, pulling her up towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The seil's bright red color made it easy to spot in the dark.

meanings.definition: To lower or raise something using a rope or cord.
meanings.sent1: We will seil down the supplies from the top of the hill.
meanings.sent2: He carefully seiled the flag to half-mast as a sign of respect.
meanings.sent3: The magician seiled the rabbit out of the hat to the audience's amazement.
meanings.sent4: She seiled her voice to a higher pitch to hit the high note.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter quickly seiled down the burning building to rescue the trapped cat.
